definition: to breed/to flourish/to cause/to provoke/to create
to grow/to nourish/to increase/to cause/juice/taste/(dialect) to spout/to spurt
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Religious cultures produce poetry and theater, not novels.
sentences.chinese: 宗教文化滋生出詩歌和戲劇，而非小說。

sentences.english: It happens when water gets trapped in your ears and allows bacteria or fungi to flourish.
sentences.chinese: 當水滯留在耳內並使細菌或真菌滋生時就會生這種病。

sentences.english: The police moved the crowd on before it could get big enough to threat law and order.
sentences.chinese: 警察趕走了人羣，以防聚集太多而滋生事端。

sentences.english: Out of Kobe grew new civic-minded energies.
sentences.chinese: 神戶的災難使得新的熱心公益的力量滋生。

sentences.english: During the court trial, the defendant told the breeding Xu This is the reason.
sentences.chinese: 在庭審中，被告人徐某道出了滋生這種想法的緣由。

sentences.english: “Hypocrisy is driven by mental processes over which we have volitional control, ” said Dr. Valdesolo, a psychologist at Amherst College.
sentences.chinese: 我們用意志控制了心理過程，從而滋生了僞善。

sentences.english: However loneliness and doleful mood also begin to be caused slowly in Ding Bao's heart.
sentences.chinese: 然而孤獨和寂寞的情緒也開始在丁寶的心中慢慢滋生。

sentences.english: Wildfires burn it cannot be spring breeze blows, and it grows.
sentences.chinese: 野火焚燒也燒不盡，春風吹過來又滋生起來。

sentences.english: In the absence of such mechanisms, corruption may thrive.
sentences.chinese: 沒有這類機制就可能滋生腐敗。

sentences.english: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut off.
sentences.chinese: 義人的口滋生智慧，乖謬的舌必被割斷。

sentences.english: The emergence of science fiction and fantasy genres have spawned a new galaxy of wraiths.
sentences.chinese: 而科幻小說與傳奇故事的出現又滋生了一大批鬼魂。

sentences.english: The interior of washing machine is damper, cause saprophytic sex mould easily.
sentences.chinese: 洗衣機的內部比較潮溼，輕易滋生腐生性黴菌。

sentences.english: "Mad Money" great harm, must not be allowed to spread.
sentences.chinese: “私房錢”危害很大，絕不能任其滋生蔓延。

sentences.english: This would create a "breeding ground for conflict"  that would leave the other person feeling like they are being taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 而這將滋生矛盾，讓另外一個人感覺自己被等閒視之。

sentences.english: The education of the cut-throat competition, a breeding ground for college students psychological speculation.
sentences.chinese: 而教育的惡性競爭，滋生了大學生的投機心理。

sentences.english: "Crony capitalism has grown up in Egypt, particularly in the past decade," says Michael Hanna, who is in Cairo for the U.S.-based Century Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 埃及滋生的是裙帶資本主義，特別是過去的十年裏。

definition: to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
hotbed/breeding ground/fig. breeding ground for crimes or sedition
growing as a thicket/overgrown/breaking out everywhere (of disease, social disorder etc)
to be in flood/to overflow (the banks)/to inundate/to spread unchecked
hidden beneath the surface/buried and concealed
to give birth/to grow (whiskers etc)/to generate/to produce
to hide dirt, to conceal corruption (idiom); to shelter evil people and accept wrongdoing/aiding and abetting wicked deeds
to arise/to come into being/to come about/to give rise to/to bring into being/to bring about/to produce/to engender/to generate/to appear/appearance/emergence/generation/production/yield
to be full of/to flood/to congest
